alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Wicomico; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:55PM EDT until August 07 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL SOMERSET...WICOMICO AND CENTRAL WORCESTER COUNTIES... At 955 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Fruitland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Salisbury, Fruitland, and Salisbury University around 1000 PM EDT. Parsonsburg around 1010 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Catchpenny, Trinity, Salisbury-Wicomico, Eden, Allen, Willards, Lakewood, Longridge, Chesapeake Heights, and Pittsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
